<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">farris pretium in trinis nundinis ad assem redegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31466.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">trade, traffic, sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius rei publicae nundinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium flagitiosissimae nundinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31466.4" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nundĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the markettime</hi>, for the most part only in the connection inter nundinum, <hi rend="ital">the time between two</hi> nundinae, and trinum nundinum, <hi rend="ital">the time of three</hi> nundinae, or at least seventeen days (reckoned from the first market-day to the third, inclusive; it was necessary that this period should expire before a bill could be put to the vote. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, § 34</bibl>): si nihil gustat inter nundinum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 214, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties priscus homo ac rusticus Romanus inter nundinum barbam radebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 214:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 214, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:32" default="NO">32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam comitia decemviris creandis in trinum nundinum indicta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>on the third market-day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatio sive non trino forte nundino promulgata sive non idoneo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in ceteris legibus trinum nundinum esse oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo nundino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31466.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The duration of the consulship, under the emperors</hi> ( = two months), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nunquam: <entryFree id="n31467" type="main" key="nunquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nunquam</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nunquis</orth>, v. numquam and numquis.</entryFree>
nuntia: <entryFree id="n31468" type="main" key="nunti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭa</orth>, v. nuntius, II. C.</entryFree>
nuntiatio: <entryFree id="n31469" type="main" key="nunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nunc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nuntio</etym>, used only in relig. and jurid. lang. <sense id="n31469.0" n="I" level="1"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a declaring, announcing; a declaration, announcement</hi> made by the augur respecting what he has observed: <cit><quote lang="la">nos nuntiationem solum habemus: consules etiam spectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31469.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an announcement, notice, declaration, information</hi>. So of an information respecting ownerless goods which fall to the fiscus: <cit><quote lang="la">variae causae sunt ex quibus nuntiatio ad fiscum fieri solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: novi operis, <hi rend="ital">an information lodged respecting a work undertaken by another to one's injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de novi operis nunciatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, tit. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1</bibl>, tit. 1; 5, etc.</sense></entryFree>
nuntiator: <entryFree id="n31470" type="main" key="nunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nunc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n31470.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reporter, declarer, announcer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparuit Christus rei maximae nuntiator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Christ. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31470.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An informer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:6" default="NO">48, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuntiatrix: <entryFree id="n31471" type="main" key="nunti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭātrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nunc-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nuntiator</etym>, <sense id="n31471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that announces</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuntio: <entryFree id="n31472" type="main" key="nunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nunc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nuntius</etym>, <sense id="n31472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to announce, declare, report, relate, narrate, make known, inform, give intelligence of</hi>, etc. (cf.: narro, indico, trado, scribo, dico, certiorem facio, etc.). </sense><sense id="n31472.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., alike of verbal and of written communications; constr. <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. of person;</hi> for the <case>acc.</case> may stand an <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, a clause with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone, or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; for the <case>dat.</case> an <case>acc.</case> with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (ante-class.); in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, both personal and impersonal, the latter most usually, esp. in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nuntiatum est, <pb n="1229" /> <cb n="NUNT" /> with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31472.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31472.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing (dat. of person)</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubito quin celerius tibi hoc rumor, quam ullius nostrum litterae nuntiārint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas quinque puer nondum tibi nuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:67:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 67, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui ac populo victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nuntiarem nuntium exoptabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem magnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod percipi possit, si ne sensus quidem vera nuntiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas,</quote> <trans><tr>to tell the time of day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:67:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 67, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:1" default="NO">10, 48, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31472.4" n="2" level="3"> With clause: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nuntiarent, prope omnes naves afflictas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiate regi vestro, regem Romanum deos facere testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae laeta continebant, quod te in urbe teneri nuntiabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus est talis, qualem esse eum tuae mihi litterae nuntiārant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae nuntiare, ne eum Lentulus aliique terrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deligit centurionem qui nuntiaret regibus ne armis disceptarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatum, ut prodiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vibius nuntiavit Pisoni Romam ad dicendam causam veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet nuntiare miserae, dicendam ad causam postero die adesset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31472.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo nuntiat patri abicere spem et uti necessitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n31472.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Absol.: Ly.</hi> Salutem multam dicito patrono. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Nuntiabo, <hi rend="ital">I will do so</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31472.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Passive</hi> constructions. </sense><sense id="n31472.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam meus nunc mortuos pater ad me nuntietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquatores premi nuntiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris motibus terrae ruere in agris nuntiabantur tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tribuni) summā vi restare nuntiabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 54, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc adeo celeriter fecit, ut simul adesse, et venire nuntiaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamjam adesse ejus equites nuntiabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31472.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conantibus, priusquam id effici posset, adesse Romanos nuntiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesari nuntiatur Sulmonenses cupere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatur Afranio magnos commeatus ad flumen constitisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubie mihi nuntiabatur Parthos transīsse Euphratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatum est nobis a M. Varrone, venisse eum Romā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paulo esset de hoc incommodo nuntiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatumque Hannibali est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occiso Sex. Roscio, qui primus Ameriam nuntiat?</quote> <trans><tr>who will be the first bearer of the tidings?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene, ita me di ament, nuntias,</quote> <trans><tr>you bring good news</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31472.10" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to denounce, inform against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam pecuniae fisco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum heres decessisset, exstitit qui bona nuntiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: opus novum, <hi rend="ital">to inform against a work undertaken by another to one's injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus novum, si tibi nuntiavero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:7:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:3" default="NO">43, 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuntius: <entryFree id="n31473" type="main" key="nunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. contr. from noventius, from obsol. novēre, to make new; v. novus</etym>. <sense id="n31473.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That announces, signifies, makes known; announcing, informing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nuntia fibra deos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratre reversuro, nuntia venit avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:32:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntia littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra In mentes hominum divinae nuntia formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 704</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes animi nuntia verba mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta venturae nuntia sortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.1" n="II" level="1"> Usually as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31473.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an announcement, message, news</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad aures nova nuntia referens,</quote> <trans><tr>this new message</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius est qui nuntiat, nuntium, quod nuntiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 896</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo nuntium erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannum perturbant nuntia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 474</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31473.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bearer of news, one who brings intelligence, a reporter, messenger, courier</hi> (freq. and class.); <cit><quote lang="la">both of persons and things: Mercurius Jovis qui nuntius perhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me rus advenit nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o hominem fortunatum, qui ejusmodi nuntios, seu potius Pegasos habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl></cit>: litteris, nuntiis, cohortationibus omnes excitare. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 20</bibl>: facere aliquem <cb n="NUPT" /> certiorem per nuntium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 24, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid audire sine capite, sine auctore, rumore nuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras et nuntios mittere ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius ibis Pelidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius adfert rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius ales, i. e. Mercurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius, nuntius Jovis et deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii afferunt Darium premi a Scythis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a woman: <cit><quote lang="la">huic dea ... utinam non hic tibi nuntius essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:141" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A messenger, the bearer of a written message</hi>, = tabellarius (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nuntio ipsius, qui litteras attulerat dici (placuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 37, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.5" n="2" level="3"> Abstract. </sense><sense id="n31473.6" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a message, news, tidings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium exoptabilem nuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opta ergo ob istunc nuntium quidvis tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inest lepos in nuntio tuo magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbum nuntium alicui perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Q. Fratre nuntii nobis tristes venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoptatum nuntium alicui afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium optatissimum accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium perferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium ferre ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribilis nuntius affertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:84:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 84, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 582</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.7" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31473.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A command, order, injunction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos senatus ad denuntiandum bellum miserat, nisi legatorum nuntio paruisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Nuntium uxori remittere or mittere, <hi rend="ital">to send one's wife a letter of divorce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56, 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22" default="NO">24, 3, 22</bibl>.—Also of a woman who separates from her husband, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —Of the annulling of a betrothment: <cit><quote lang="la">si invito patrono nuntium sponsa liberta remiserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—Of the rejection of the marriage contract by the parents and guardians: <cit><quote lang="la">ego adeo jam illi remittam nuntium adfini meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si puellae tutores ad infringenda sponsalia nuntium miserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Hence, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti nuntium remittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to renounce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31473.11" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuntĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female messenger, she that brings tidings</hi>: nuntia fulva Jovis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the eagle</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia nuntia vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox nuntia cladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama nuntia veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga nuntia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 704</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:141" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 141</bibl>; B. 1. a. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra.</sense></entryFree>
nuper: <entryFree id="n31474" type="main" key="nu_per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>for novum-per; cf. semper</etym>, <sense id="n31474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">newly, lately, recently, not long ago</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31474.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam haec inter nos nuper notitia admodumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Flect. Ussing. (al. nupera): <cit><quote lang="la">nuper, et quid dico nuper? immo vero modo, ac plane paulo ante vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">99</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 14 al.: de quo sum nuper tecum locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui nuper Romae fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 19, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, quod fecisti nuper in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseraeque nuper virgines nuptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>.—Followed by <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo quod ille nuperrime dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam nuperrime dictum facillime memoriae mandatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31474.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc nuper,</quote> <trans><tr>a little while ago, just now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; Ter. Eun. prooem. 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 16, p. 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31474.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">recently, in modern times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ante philosophiam patefactam, quae nuper inventa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ea. quae nuper, id est paucis ante saeculis, reperta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a time three years back,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 32, 89</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">four years back,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31474.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Formerly, once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixi puellis nuper idoneus ... Nunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros regali conspectus in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nuperus: <entryFree id="n31475" type="main" key="nu_pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nuper</etym>, <sense id="n31475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">late, fresh, recent</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">recens captum hominem nuperum et novicium Te perdocere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti nuperi a silvā (al. nuper),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuperrimus etiam proferebant antiquissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 606</bibl></cit> P.; Cod. Th. 15, 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
nups: <entryFree id="n31476" type="main" key="Nups"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nups</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nupsia, Nup-sis</orth>), <sense id="n31476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two cities in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35</bibl>, §§ 178, 179.</sense></entryFree>
nupta: <entryFree id="n31477" type="main" key="nupta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nupta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. nubo. <cb n="NUSC" /></entryFree>
nuptalicius: <entryFree id="n31478" type="main" key="nupta_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptālīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nupta</etym>, <sense id="n31478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a marriage wedding-, nuptial</hi> (only in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:194" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptiabilis: <entryFree id="n31479" type="gloss" key="nupti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nuptiae</etym>, <sense id="n31479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marriageable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta, nubilis, nuptiabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptiae: <entryFree id="n31480" type="main" key="nupti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<case>dat.</case> nuptis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7421</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [nupta], <sense id="n31480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marriage, wedding, nuptials</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31480.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exornatis nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ego cum Casinā faciam nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias adornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquere cenam ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nuptias aliquem conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias alicui conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nuptiis alicujus cenare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum expers,</quote> <trans><tr>unmarried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eis nuptiis abhorrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nuptiae non diuturnae fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornificia vetula sane et multarum nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut minores ante tradamus ad nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 29, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providebit puellae nuptias et vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Exod. 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31480.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">sexual intercourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus mater cotidianis nuptiis delectabatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31480.3" n="b" level="4"> Of <hi rend="ital">a change of form</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">union with a new body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae suae monstruosae nuptiae, said of Lucius, who was transformed into an ass,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 22, p. 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptialis: <entryFree id="n31481" type="main" key="nupti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nuptiae</etym>, <sense id="n31481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a marriage, wedding-, nuptial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 12 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptĭā-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as at a wedding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus nuptialiter laeta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 705</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptiator: <entryFree id="n31482" type="main" key="nupti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who marries</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Jov. 1</bibl>, n. 38: nuptiatores, <foreign lang="greek">gamosto/loi</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
nupto: <entryFree id="n31483" type="main" key="nupto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nupto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n31483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [nubo], <hi rend="ital">to marry wed</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Sod. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptula: <entryFree id="n31484" type="hapax" key="nuptu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nupta</etym>, <sense id="n31484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young wife</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nupturio: <entryFree id="n31485" type="main" key="nuptu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, īre</itype>, <sense id="n31485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> [nubo], <hi rend="ital">to desire to marry</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 319, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuptus: <entryFree id="n31486" type="main" key="nuptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from nubo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31487" type="main" key="nuptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nubo</etym>, <sense id="n31487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering, veiling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=72" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 72</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31487.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">marriage, wedlock</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuptumque passa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solenni nuptu filias locabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 59" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nura: <entryFree id="n31488" type="main" key="nu^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. nurus.</entryFree>
nuricula: <entryFree id="n31489" type="gloss" key="nu^ri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nurus</etym>, <sense id="n31489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter-in-law</hi>, Inscr. De Vita Inscr. Benev. 53, 136.</sense></entryFree>
nursia: <entryFree id="n31490" type="main" key="Nursi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nursĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nurtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sabine city</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Norcia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 715</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31490.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nursīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nursian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:421" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:20:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nursīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nursians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nurtia: <entryFree id="n31491" type="main" key="Nurti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nurtĭa</orth>, v. Nortia.</entryFree>
nurus: <entryFree id="n31492" type="greek" key="nu^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭrus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> nuru, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl>.— Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŭra</orth>, Rénier, Inscr. Afr. 1590), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for snurus, kindr. with Sanscr. snusha and the Old Germ. snur, Schnur; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">nuo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n31492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter-in-law</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31492.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno animo omnes socrus oderunt nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 501</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tua, Laomedon, oritur nurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Aurora, the wife of Tithonus, a son of Laomedon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:729" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrum nuruumque caterva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:159" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 220</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31492.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31492.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A son's betrothed bride</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31492.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of a grandson</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great-grandson</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31492.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A young woman, married woman</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inque nurus Parthas dedecus illud eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:75:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 75, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus Latinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 366</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nus: <entryFree id="n31493" type="greek" key="nu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūs</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nou=s</foreign>. <sense id="n31493.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the understanding</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 126</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31493.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">one of the æons of Valentinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nuscitiosum: <entryFree id="n31494" type="gloss" key="nuscitio_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nuscitiōsum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nusciciōsum</orth>) <itype>Ateius Philologus ait appellari solitum</itype>, qui propter oculorum vitium parum videret. <pb n="1230" /> <cb n="NUTR" /> At Opilius Aurelius nusciciones (<sense id="n31494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fort. leg.</hi> nuscitiones) esse caecitudines nocturnas: Aelius Stilo, qui plus videret vesperi, quam meridie, nec cognosceret. nisi quod usque ad oculos admovisset, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=173" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 173</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
nusquam: <entryFree id="n31495" type="main" key="nusquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nusquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ne-usquam</etym>, <sense id="n31495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nowhere, in no place</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31495.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam invenio Naucratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrem nusquam invenio gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive est illa scripta uspiam, sive nusquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 373</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite arbitrari me, cum a vobis discessero, nusquam aut nullum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 22, 79</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam non,</quote> <trans><tr>everywhere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: nusquam alibi, <hi rend="ital">nowhere else</hi>, Cic. Ac. prooem. 2, 32, 103; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam quidquam,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31495.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31495.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">On no occasion, nowhere, in nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam equidem quicquam deliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestabo sumptum nusquam melius poni posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31495.4" n="B" level="2"> With verbs of motion, <hi rend="ital">no whither, to no place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam abeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31495.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad id omnia referri oporteat, ipsum autem nusquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem nusquam alio natam, quam ad serviendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 54, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31495.6" n="C" level="2"> Nusquam esse, <hi rend="ital">not to exist, not to be</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo nunc Dama sodalis Nusquam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutabilis: <entryFree id="n31496" type="main" key="nu_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nuto</etym>, <sense id="n31496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tottering</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socrat. p. 44, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutabundus: <entryFree id="n31497" type="main" key="nu_ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tottering, staggering</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31497.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 6, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31497.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vacillating, uncertain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutamen: <entryFree id="n31498" type="hapax" key="nu_ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nodding, waving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulo pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 399</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutatio: <entryFree id="n31499" type="main" key="nu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n31499.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nodding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 49, § 135</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31499.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A swaying</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31499.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens et in utramque partem nutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31499.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shaking, tottering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutatio reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutiquam: <entryFree id="n31500" type="main" key="nuti^quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nutĭquam</orth>, v. neutiquam.</entryFree>
nuto: <entryFree id="n31501" type="main" key="nu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n31501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [nuo (of re-nuo, ab-nuo); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">neu/w</foreign>; cf. numen, nutus], <hi rend="ital">to nod</hi> with the head. </sense><sense id="n31501.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illa ulli homini nutet, nictet, annuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite nutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: crebro capitis motu nutans. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutans. Distorquens oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31501.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to command by a nod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutat ne loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31501.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sway to and fro, to totter, shake, stagger</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31501.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutant circumspectantibus galeae, et incerti trepidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 629</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 682</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percutiens nutanti pectora mento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutans machinamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutantem vulnere civem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:501" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:256" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 256</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31501.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31501.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To waver in one's opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judgment; to doubt, hesitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam Democritus nutare videtur in naturā Deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic animus vario labefactus vulnere nutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 375</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:614" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 614</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31501.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To falter in one's fidelity, to be faithless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac primo Festūs nutabat, palam Vitellium, occultis nuntiis Vespasianum fovens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31501.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be ready to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give way; to totter, to waver, fail, be weak, falter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna nutabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto discrimine urbs nutabat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutantem aciem victor equitatus incursat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 49: rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia nutantia Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:590" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutantem hostem praevenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi nutante ruinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 493</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutribilis: <entryFree id="n31502" type="main" key="nu_tri_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nutrio</etym>, <sense id="n31502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishing, nutritious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutribiliores suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:10:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 212</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrī-bĭlia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">nourishing food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 108</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrībĭlĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">so as to be nourished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reared</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl>. <cb n="NUTR" /></sense></entryFree>
nutricatio: <entryFree id="n31503" type="main" key="nu_tri_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nutrico</etym>, <sense id="n31503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suckling, nursing</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">munus nutricationis grave ac difficile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum nutricationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a nourishing, rearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutricatus: <entryFree id="n31504" type="main" key="nu_tri_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suckling, nursing</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">plane eductus in nutricatu Venerio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31504.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A nourishing, rearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba non evellenda in nutricatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:49" default="NO">1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9" default="NO">3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutricio: <entryFree id="n31505" type="gloss" key="nu_tri_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nutrio</etym>, <sense id="n31505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nurse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1891, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutricius: <entryFree id="n31506" type="main" key="nu_tri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nutrix</etym>, <sense id="n31506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that suckles, nourishes, nurses</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31506.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Faustulum nescit pastorem fuisse nutricium, qui Romulum et Remum educavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutriciae curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus radices tenero velut nutricio sinu recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31506.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31506.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bringer up, a tutor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in procuratione regni, propter aetatem pueri, nutricius ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2964</bibl>.—Also, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonius afflatu nutricium exercebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 67, § 337</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31506.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrī-cĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nurse, governess, tutoress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108</bibl>, n. 30.—</sense><sense id="n31506.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nursing; nourishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius pio maternoque nutricio aeger convalui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricia ducere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia infantum nutricia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31506.6" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nurse's wages</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ta\ qrepth/ria</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
nutrico: <entryFree id="n31507" type="main" key="nu_tri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suckle, nourish, bring up, rear</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros nutricare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrofae nutricare octonos porcos parvulos primo possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:2:8" default="NO">2, 2, 8</bibl>: nutricatur oliva, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viperam sub alā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31507.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish, support, sustain</hi>: bona mea inhiant; <cit><quote lang="la">at certatim nutricant et munerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus omnia, sicut membra et partes suas, nutricatur et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 478, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum paupertas nutricata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 285, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutricula: <entryFree id="n31508" type="main" key="nu_tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nurse</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid voveat dulci nutricula majus alumno?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulae nutricularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31508.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">she who nourishes, maintains, preserves</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nutriculae praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gellius nutricula seditiosorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricula causidicorum Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa nutricula,</quote> <trans><tr>in which one was brought up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutrimen: <entryFree id="n31509" type="main" key="nu_tri_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nutrio</etym>, <sense id="n31509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 354</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> in Matt. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nutrimentalis: <entryFree id="n31510" type="main" key="nu_tri_menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīmentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nutrimentum</etym>, <sense id="n31510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishing</hi> (late Lat.), Dion. Exig. Greg. Creat. Hom. 15.</sense></entryFree>
nutrimentum: <entryFree id="n31511" type="main" key="nu_tri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nutrio</etym>, <sense id="n31511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourishment, nutriment</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: per hanc nutrimentorum consuetudinem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31511.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">support, nourishment</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro nutrimento omni est raritas vulneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 36, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepitque ignem foliis atque arida circum Nutrimenta dedit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fuel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec reddita caro nutrimenta patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:571" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 571</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31511.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31511.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truculentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31511.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrīmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a bringing up, rearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrimentorum ejus locus ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nutrio: <entryFree id="n31512" type="main" key="nu_tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nūtrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ii, ītum</itype> (contr. form, nutrīmus for nutrivimus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 26</bibl>: <sense id="n31512.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">nutribat for nutriebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 572</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:29" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 29</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nutribant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 485</bibl></cit>: nutribo for nutriam, Rhemn. Palaem. 1383; Cledon. 1914.—In the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form, nutritor for nutrito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 425</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 798</bibl> P.), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root snu-, flow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/w</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">snevw</foreign>), swim; cf. nurus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to suckle, nourish, feed, foster, bring up, rear</hi> (syn. alere; not in Cic., but v. nutrix and nutrimentum). </sense><sense id="n31512.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos lupa nutrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutritus lacte ferino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilignā nutritus glande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balaenae mammis nutriunt fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpente ciconia pullos Nutrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 75</bibl></cit>: taurus nutritus in herbā, <cb n="NUTU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31512.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish, support, maintain, foster</hi>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">terra herbas Nutrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtos roscido umore nutrire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutriri cinere vult ruta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges humo nutriente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pax Cererem nutrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:704" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 704</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Edonis nutritum missile ventis,</quote> <trans><tr>a shaft taken from a tree toughened by storms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 340</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31512.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To nourish, nurse, take care of, attend to</hi> the body: <cit><quote lang="la">cura corporum nutriendorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrum nutrire per eos cibos, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <trans><tr>to heal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum naturae in filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl></cit>: comam, Hier. in Amos, 8, 9 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 14</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem, mulierum in facie incorruptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 91, § 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31512.4" n="3" level="3"> Nutrire vinum, <hi rend="ital">to mix wine with spices</hi>, in order that it may keep, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutritum vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31512.5" n="4" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutriuntur optime (mensae citreae) splendescuntque, manu siccā fricatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31512.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to nourish, cherish, support, cultivate, sustain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles Nutrita faustis sub penetralibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
