(not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">pessulum ostio obdo,</quote> <trans><tr>slip the bolt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forem obdo,</quote> <trans><tr>shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obde forem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obditis a tergo foribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores obditae ferratis trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Propontidis fauces Porcius Cato sic obditis navibus quasi portam obseravit,</quote> <trans><tr>placed opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus ceram obdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feralibus amiculis instrictus atque obditus,</quote> <trans><tr>enveloped, wrapped in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos in mutuos nexus obdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 137.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to expose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nulli malo latus obdit apertum,</quote> <trans><tr>exposes an unguarded side to no evil-minded person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obdormio: <entryFree id="n31594" type="main" key="obdormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n31594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to fall asleep</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ebrium obdormivisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Endymion nescio quando in Latmo obdormivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub taxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem obdormire volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atiam obdormisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepetam substernere obdormituris utile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 56, § 158</bibl></cit> (Jan, eo dormituris).—</sense><sense id="n31594.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to fall asleep in death</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obdormivit in Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 7, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31594.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnem obdormivi crapulam,</quote> <trans><tr>have slept off all my debauch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obdormisco: <entryFree id="n31595" type="main" key="obdormisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obdormisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [obdormio], <hi rend="ital">to fall asleep</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibidem obdormiscemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 116</bibl>: quid melius, quam in mediis vitae laboribus obdormiscere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post cibum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantante eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines summā in aquā obdormiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obdormito: <entryFree id="n31596" type="main" key="obdormi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obdormĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to fall asleep</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Carm. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obduco: <entryFree id="n31597" type="main" key="obdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum</itype> (<sense id="n31597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> sync. obduxe, Arg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 7</bibl>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw before, lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards, to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">around, draw over</hi> (class. and very freq.; syn.: obtendo, obtego). </sense><sense id="n31597.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oppidum exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: vim Gallicam obduc contra in acie, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: ab utroque latere collis transversam fossam obduxit, <hi rend="ital">drew forward, drew, made</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">extended a trench</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: vestem, <hi rend="ital">to draw on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seram,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw, close, fasten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:5:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callum,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31597.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover by drawing over; to cover over, overspread, surround, envelop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci obducuntur libro, aut cortice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus, of the sun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina cortice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obducta cicatrix,</quote> <trans><tr>a closed, healed scar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obductā nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>overcast, cloudy, dark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To close, shut up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">obducta penetralia Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1548" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1548</bibl></cit>. mors oculos coepit obducere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:19" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw in, drink down, swallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: pultarium <cb n="OBED" /> mulsi, <hi rend="ital">to drink up</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To swallow up, overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti eos, eum exercitum, eos hostes, eosque homines, urbes agrosque eorum ... obducatis (an imprecation to the gods below),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31597.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To contract, wrinkle, knit</hi> the brow: <cit><quote lang="la">obductā solvatur fronte senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To injure, harm</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.9" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring home in opposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rivalry to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum putat uxor sibi Obduxe scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:Arg. 1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. Arg. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31597.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31597.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread over</hi>: obsidionem, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=198" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 198</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 11 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimis rebus tenebras obducere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to darken, obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim tenebris sese obducentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31597.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover, conceal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obductus verbis dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obductos rescindere luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae obducere cicatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:Agr. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31597.14" n="2" level="3"> Qs., <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass, spend</hi> time: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque obduxi posterum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obductio: <entryFree id="n31598" type="main" key="obducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-ductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obduco</etym>, <sense id="n31598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering, veiling, enveloping</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n31598.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila inimica obductione pendent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31598.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a veiling</hi> of criminals before their execution: <cit><quote lang="la">obductio capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccles. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obducto: <entryFree id="n31599" type="hapax" key="obducto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obducto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct in opposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rivalry to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pol ego patiar ... measque in aedes sic scorta obductarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. obduco, I. B. 7.</sense></entryFree>
obductus: <entryFree id="n31600" type="main" key="obductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obduco.</entryFree>
obdulcesco: <entryFree id="n31601" type="gloss" key="obdulcesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dulcesco</orth>, <itype>dulcui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become sweet</hi>: obdulcesco, <foreign lang="greek">perigluku/nomai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">in earum familiaritate obdulcuisses mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:20:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obdulco: <entryFree id="n31602" type="main" key="obdulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dulco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sweeten, make sweet</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:146" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:1:12" default="NO">4, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 12: obdulcatus panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes amari obdulcati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obduratio: <entryFree id="n31603" type="main" key="obdu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obdūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obduro</etym>, <sense id="n31603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hardening;</hi> of the mind, <hi rend="ital">obduration, obduracy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 105" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 77</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
obdurefacio: <entryFree id="n31604" type="hapax" key="obdu_re^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obdūrĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-durus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n31604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hard, to harden</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obduresco: <entryFree id="n31605" type="main" key="obdu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dūresco</orth>, <itype>rui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become hard, to harden</hi> (class. only in the trop. signif.; syn. occalesco). </sense><sense id="n31605.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen diuturnitate obdurescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervis divinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31605.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become hardened, insensible, obdurate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita miser cubando in lecto hic expectando obdurui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ista obduruimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu obduruerat et percalluerat civitatis incredibilis patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi obduruisset animus ad dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum alii obduruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgonis vultu,</quote> <trans><tr>at the sight of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dociliora sunt ingenia, priusquam obduruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obduro: <entryFree id="n31606" type="main" key="obdu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-dūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n31606.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to harden, render hard</hi> (only postclass.); <cit><quote lang="la">in the trop. signif.: obdurare se contra manifestam veritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obdurata patientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obdurata nequitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obdurata verecundia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 9</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to harden the heart against God</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">obdurare corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:94:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 94, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 15, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non obduretur quis vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31606.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hardened;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">to hold out, persist, endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernegabo atque obdurabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persta, atque obdura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfer et obdura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: quare obduretur hoc triduum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obediens: <entryFree id="n31607" type="main" key="o^be_di^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēdĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. oboedio.</entryFree>
obedienter: <entryFree id="n31608" type="main" key="o^be_di^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēdĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. oboedio, <sense id="n31608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
obeditio: <entryFree id="n31609" type="main" key="o^be_diti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ēditĭo</orth>, v. oboeditio.</entryFree>
obedo: <entryFree id="n31610" type="main" key="o^be^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat, eat away, devour</hi> (used only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos>).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec obesa cavamine terra est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 344</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēsus</orth>,<cb n="OBEO" />  a, um. </sense><sense id="n31610.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wasted away, lean, meagre</hi>: corpore pectoreque undique obeso, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 361, 17</bibl>: (obesum hic notavimus proprie magis quam usitate dictum pro exili atque gracilento, Gell. ib.: obesum gracile et exile, Non. l. l.).—</sense><sense id="n31610.2" n="II" level="1"> Mid., that has eaten itself fat; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">fat, stout, plump</hi>: obesus pinguis quasi ob edendum factus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll. (not in Cic.; perh. not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: opimus, pinguis): corpus neque gracile, neque obesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obesissimus venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 263</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces obesae,</quote> <trans><tr>swollen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 497</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31610.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gross, coarse, heavy, dull</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): munera quid mihi quidve tabellas Mittis nec firmo juveni neque naris obesae? <hi rend="ital">that has not a quick nose, that is not nice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, = obtusae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:147" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: obeso somno mori, <hi rend="ital">idle, lazy, inactive</hi>, of bees, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sat. 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obeliscus: <entryFree id="n31611" type="greek" key="o^be^liscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĕliscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)beli/skos</foreign> (a small spit; hence), <sense id="n31611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An obelisk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes ex Syenite marmore fecere reges, obeliscos vocantes Solis numini sacratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 64 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rose-bud</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31611.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mark in books placed against suspected passages, an obelisk</hi> (†), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 10, 2</bibl> (cf. obelus).</sense></entryFree>
obelus: <entryFree id="n31612" type="greek" key="o^be^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o)belo/s</foreign> (a spit), <sense id="n31612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a critical mark</hi> shaped like a spit (†), placed opposite suspected passages in books, <hi rend="ital">an obelisk</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sap. 13</bibl> prooem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obeo: <entryFree id="n31613" type="main" key="o^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi</itype> (obivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 801</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 4, 97, 1</bibl>; <sense id="n31613.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">contr. obit for obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1042" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1042</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:559" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 559</bibl>), ĭtum, 4 (lengthened form, obinunt obeunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=189" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 189</bibl> Müll.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31613.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards, to come in, to go to meet, go against</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31613.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">donec vis obiit,</quote> <trans><tr>until force intervene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum acris vis obeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obit infera Perseus in loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=465" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 465</bibl></cit> (Grot. 718): <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes hostium conatus,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to meet, to oppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31613.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31613.4" n="1" level="3"> Of constellations, <hi rend="ital">to go down, to set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abditur Orion, obit et Lepus abditus umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:46:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 46, 3</bibl></cit> (Grot. 716); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:210" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an sidera obirent, nascerenturve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 24, § 95</bibl></cit>.—Of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">in reliquis orientis aut obeuntis solis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in undis Sol fit uti videatur obire et condere lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 433</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to fall, perish</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">occido, pereo, occumbo). —Of cities: et Agamede obiit et Hiera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 117</bibl>.— —Hence, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo cruciatu ut pereas atque obeas cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1045" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1045</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">tecum vivere amem, tecum obeam libens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul se cum illis obituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudio,</quote> <trans><tr>to die of joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <trans><tr>of a disease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 71, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:47:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 47, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:102:1" default="NO">2, 102, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntariā morte obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte subitā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinā morte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 53, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (freq. and class.), <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come to</hi> a thing or place. </sense><sense id="n31613.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Acherontem nunc obibo, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ob, p. 201 Müll. (Trag. v. 278 Vahl.): tantum restitisset urbis, quantum flamma obire non potuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>to reach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31613.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To travel over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through; to wander through, traverse, visit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero Alcides tantum telluris obivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas regiones barbarorum pedibus obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villas,</quote> <trans><tr>to visit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31613.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To run over</hi> with the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to survey, review</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis exercitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to survey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 447</bibl></cit>.—In speaking, <hi rend="ital">to go over, mention, recount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione omnes civitates,</quote> <trans><tr>to enumerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go around, surround, overspread, envelop</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem limbus obibat Aureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 482</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To apply</hi> <pb n="1234" /> <cb n="OBEX" /> <hi rend="ital">one's self to, to engage in, attend to</hi> any business or undertaking; <hi rend="ital">to enter upon</hi> an office; <hi rend="ital">to discharge, perform, execute, accomplish</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">obeundi negotii studio tot loca adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatum obeundarum causā,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter upon, take possession of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage in battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:710" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 710</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter upon, undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularia munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus vigiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica ac privata officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque privatam rem ... neque publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ad omnia simul obire unus non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform, execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31613.13" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To meet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonium,</quote> <trans><tr>to meet one's bail, appear at the appointed time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to appear on the day appointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum petitiones tuae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be a candidate the first year the law permits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, diem suum obire, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea diem suom obiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diem supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply, diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl>; hence, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte obitā (sc. ob rem publicam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 83</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> (anteand post-class.): <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um, for mortuus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> P.: obiti, <hi rend="ital">the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitis libatione profunditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">OBITAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2673</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obequito: <entryFree id="n31614" type="main" key="o^be^qui^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ĕquĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n31614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to ride towards, ride up to</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n31614.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obequitando castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peditibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31614.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obequitans moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31614.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces obequitantis acceptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:50" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n31614.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non obequitabit nec illis vibrantibus concitatisque sententiis velut missilibus utetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oberro: <entryFree id="n31615" type="main" key="o^berro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-erro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n31615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to wander, rove</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ramble about</hi> a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31615.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oberrare tentoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustela quae in domibus nostris oberrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 16, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives arat Curibus, quantum non milvus oberrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31615.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris oberrantibus rivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31615.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31615.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flit, hover before one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi monstrum oberrat,</quote> <trans><tr>hovers before my eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1280" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanti periculi ... imago oculis oberraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31615.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To err, mistake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut citharoedus Ridetur, chordā qui semper oberrat eādem,</quote> <trans><tr>blunders at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 356</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obescet: <entryFree id="n31616" type="gloss" key="o^bescet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbescet</orth>, v. obsum <sense id="n31616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obesitas: <entryFree id="n31617" type="main" key="o^be_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obesus</etym>, <sense id="n31617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatness, stoutness, corpulence, obesity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">et obesitas ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24</bibl>.—Of trees: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbores) laborant obesitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obeso: <entryFree id="n31618" type="hapax" key="o^be_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fatten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">madefacto triticeo pane obesant avem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 4</bibl></cit> (al. obescant).</sense></entryFree>
obesus: <entryFree id="n31619" type="main" key="o^be_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of obedo, q. v.</entryFree>
obex: <entryFree id="n31620" type="main" key="o_bex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōbex</orth>, <itype>obĭcis</itype> (objĭcis), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> (of either gender indifferently; very rare in <sense id="n31620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.; acc.</hi> not found, v. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 489) [obicio, that which is cast or placed before; hence], <hi rend="ital">a bolt, bar; a barrier, wall</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n31620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: obices pessuli, serae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=187" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 187</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fultosque emuniit obice postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 227</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 780</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrati portarum obices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obices portarum subversi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffractis portarum obicibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>: infirmā scamellorum obice fultae fores, App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 615</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce maris magnā claudit nos obice pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 377</bibl></cit>: quā vi maria alta tumescant Obicibus ruptis, <hi rend="ital">their barriers</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">their rocky shores</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hinderance, impediment, obstacle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud hanc obicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per obices viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33, 11</bibl>: nullae obices, nulli contumeliarum gradus, <hi rend="ital">obstacles<cb n="OBIC" />  to admission</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:47:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 47, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 708</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obf: <entryFree id="n31621" type="main" key="obf"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obf-</orth>, v. off-.</entryFree>
obg: <entryFree id="n31622" type="main" key="obg"><orth extent="full" lang="la">obg-</orth>, v. ogg-.</entryFree>
obhaereo: <entryFree id="n31623" type="hapax" key="o^bhaere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-haerĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n31623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to stick fast to</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">navis obhaerens vado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qui forte obhaereant ac resistant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obhaeresco: <entryFree id="n31624" type="main" key="o^bhaeresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-haeresco</orth>, <itype>haesi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to stick fast, remain stuck;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perf., to be stuck fast, to cleave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum stirpibus obhaerescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 19</bibl></cit>: ubi in medio nobis equosacer obhaesit Flumine, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 420</bibl>: consurgenti ei primum lacinia obhaesit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31624.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cleave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cling to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrisque pecunia sua obhaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obherbescere: <entryFree id="n31625" type="gloss" key="o^bherbesce^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-herbescĕre</orth>, <itype>herbam increscere</itype> (<sense id="n31625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become grass</hi>), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=190" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 190</bibl> and 191 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
obhorreo: <entryFree id="n31626" type="hapax" key="o^bhorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n31626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to bristle with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">prasii alterum genus sanguineis punctis obhorret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl></cit> dub. (Sill. abhorret).</sense></entryFree>
obhumo: <entryFree id="n31627" type="main" key="o^bhu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-hŭmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n31627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cover with earth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obicio: <entryFree id="n31628" type="main" key="o_bi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ōbĭcĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">objĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype> (cf. abicio, etc.; <sense id="n31628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> objexim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">objexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-jacio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards, to throw to, to hold before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out, to offer, present, expose;</hi> constr. usu. <hi rend="ital">aliquid (aliquem) alicui</hi>, or simply <hi rend="ital">aliquid;</hi> but sometimes also, instead of the <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">pro aliquā re, contra, ad, in aliquid;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> passages; also with <hi rend="ital">adversus;</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 5</bibl> Drak. (syn. oppono). </sense><sense id="n31628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei nos Glaucomam ob oculos obiciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alia quae obiciant non habuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidae corpus feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offam (Cerbero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces diripiunt carnes objectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 8, § 17</bibl></cit> (Jan, abiectas): argentum, <hi rend="ital">to throw to</hi> one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 4</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to throw to the wild beasts</hi> in the circus: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos homines laniandos obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem veteris vini naribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold before, present to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tale visum objectum est a deo dormienti,</quote> <trans><tr>brought before, presented to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 1, 16, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (sicae) ego vos obici pro me non sum passus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be exposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum tantae magnitudinis flumini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne objexis manum,</quote> <trans><tr>don't raise your hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31628.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place before</hi> by way of defence or hinderance; <hi rend="ital">to cast in the way, set against, oppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium vallum contra ascensum transgressionemque Gallorum ... obicio et oppono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carros pro vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ericium portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucibus portūs navem submersam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 66: se hostium telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ei objecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo aggere objecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of arms: <cit><quote lang="la">objecta tela perfregit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 23, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeosque ad tela sinistris Protecti obiciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>oppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecit sese ad currum,</quote> <trans><tr>threw himself before the chariot</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 372</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31628.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31628.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over, to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring before, to present; to give up, expose to</hi> any thing; and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring upon</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to impart, superinduce, cause, occasion</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem peccatis et fraudibus obice nubem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique victi et debilitati objectā specie voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem morti,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver up, abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicitur (consulatus) contionibus seditiosorum ... ad omne denique periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 3</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam me pro salute vestrā in tot ac tantas dimicationes ... objecissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere se in impetus profligatorum hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se unico consule objecto adversus tribuniciam potestatem perlatam legem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 5</bibl></cit>: qui multa Thebano populo acerba objecit funera, <hi rend="ital">has</hi> <cb n="OBIT" /> <hi rend="ital">brought on</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">caused</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 35</bibl>, moram alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 8</bibl>: ut hanc laetitiam nec opinanti primus obicerem, <hi rend="ital">that I might have set before him</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prepared for him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui eam mentem, ut patriam prodat,</quote> <trans><tr>to suggest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui lucrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem alicui objecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 479</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass., to be occasioned, to befall, happen, occur</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi mala res obicitur aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum mihi obicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicitur animo metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31628.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the way, interpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis exceptio interponitur a reo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:119" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui dilatoria obicitur exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31628.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to throw out against</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to taunt, reproach</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">upbraid with</hi> any thing, as a crime (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">criminor, exprobro): facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui multa probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilitatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicit mihi, me ad Baias fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius ista viris obicienda memento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato objecit ut probrum M. Nobiliori, quod is in provinciam poëtas duxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl>: furta, Auct. Dom. 35, 93: eloquentiam ut vitium, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de, to reproach</hi> one <hi rend="ital">respecting, on account of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">de Cispio mihi igitur obicies? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 75</bibl></cit>; Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 2</bibl>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod objectum est de pudicitiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">objec-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n31628.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lying before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula objecta Alexandriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva pro nativo muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyprus Syriae objecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31628.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exposed;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">objectus fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31628.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">objecta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">charges, accusations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de objectis non confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:35:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 35, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecta vel negare vel defendere vel minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objecta diluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:93" default="NO">9, 2, 93</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obiens: <entryFree id="n31629" type="main" key="o^bi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĭens</orth>, <itype>euntis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obeo.</entryFree>
obigito: <entryFree id="n31630" type="hapax" key="obi^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-ĭgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-agito</etym>, <sense id="n31630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>: obstant, obstringillant, obigitant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 147, 9</bibl> (Sat. v. 5 Vahl.); cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=189" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 189</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
obinductus: <entryFree id="n31631" type="gloss" key="o^binductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbinductus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">parei/saktos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
obinunt: <entryFree id="n31632" type="gloss" key="o^bi^nunt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĭnunt</orth>, v. obeo <sense id="n31632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obirascor: <entryFree id="n31633" type="main" key="o^bi_rascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-īrascor</orth>, <itype>īrātus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to be angry at</hi> any thing (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. obiratio): obirascens fortunae animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: cum male audiunt, obirascuntur. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 275, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., angered, angry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae obirati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obiratio: <entryFree id="n31634" type="hapax" key="o^bi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obirascor</etym>, <sense id="n31634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being angry, anger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus nebulonis obiratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit> dub.; v. Orell. ad loc. (B. and K., oratione).</sense></entryFree>
obiter: <entryFree id="n31635" type="main" key="o^bi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏb-ĭter</orth>, <sense id="n31635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., on the way, in going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passing along</hi> (except in Laber., not anteAug.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 187</bibl> P. Augustus found fault with Tiberius for using per viam instead of obiter, Charis. l. l.). </sense><sense id="n31635.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">obiter leget aut scribet,</quote> <trans><tr>on the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:241" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae, quas aqua verset obiter et molat,</quote> <trans><tr>as it flows along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:48" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 11, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31635.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31635.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">By the way, in passing, incidentally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogo ego: Quot estis? obiterque per rimam speculari coepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem linit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:481" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in hoc quidem tam molesto tacebant officio, sed obiter cantabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet obiter vanitatem magicam hic quoque coarguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:29" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1, 9, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31635.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Forthwith, straightway, immediately</hi> (very rare): <foreign lang="greek">e)n tw=| au)tw=|</foreign> inibi, obiter, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">reducant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 183, 35</bibl></cit>: ut obiter revertantur, Auct. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
obitus: <entryFree id="n31636" type="main" key="o^bi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from obeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31637" type="main" key="o^bi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŏbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n31637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> obiti, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 24 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n31637.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going</hi> <pb n="1235" /> <cb n="OBJE" /> <hi rend="ital">to, approaching; an approach, a visit</hi> (perhaps only ante- and post-class.; syn. adventus): obitu dicebant pro aditu, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=188" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 188</bibl> Müll.: ecquis est qui interrumpit sermonem meum obitu suo?
