Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 21 sq.</bibl>: ut voluptati obitus, sermo, adventus suus quocumque adveneris, Semper siet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 19</bibl> (obitus occursus: ob enim significat contra; <cit><quote lang="la">ergo obitus aditus): civitatum multarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31637.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going down, setting</hi> (the class. signif. of the word; syn. occasus). </sense><sense id="n31637.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the heavenly bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">solis et lunae reliquorumque siderum ortus, obitus motusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 393</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum ortus atque obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum obitus et ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 257</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31637.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">downfall, ruin, destruction, death</hi>, etc. (syn. interitus): <cit><quote lang="la">post obitum vel potius excessum Romuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:30:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 30, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: post optimi regis obitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>: posteaquam mihi renuntiatum est de obitu Tulliae, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obitus consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post eorum obitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum miserata dolorem Difficilesque obitus,</quote> <trans><tr>her painful death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 501</bibl></cit>: post obitum occasumque nostrum, <hi rend="ital">since my ruin</hi> (i. e. exile), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium interitus atque obitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit> (al. leg. ortus): <cit><quote lang="la">dici beatus ante obitum nemo debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 137</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31637.5" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to obeo, II. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">An entering upon, undertaking</hi> a thing (post-class.): fugae, Tert. Fug. ap. Persec. 1.</sense></entryFree>
objaceo: <entryFree id="n31638" type="main" key="obja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <sense id="n31638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to lie before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over against</hi> a thing (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic. or Cæs.): Acherontem nunc obibo, ubi mortis thesauri objacent, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ob, p. 201 Müll. (Trag. v. 278 Vahl.); cf.: objacuisse ante jacuisse, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">objacens sarcinarum cumulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa objacentia pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua objacent falcibus noxia colligi debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 93" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia Ioniis fluctibus objacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a meridie Aegyptus objacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objectaculum: <entryFree id="n31639" type="hapax" key="objecta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>objecto</etym>, <sense id="n31639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barrier, dam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
objectamen: <entryFree id="n31640" type="gloss" key="objecta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an objection, reproach</hi>: objectamen, <foreign lang="greek">e)/gklhma</foreign>, Vet. Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
objectamentum: <entryFree id="n31641" type="main" key="objecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">objectamenta jurgio prolata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objectatio: <entryFree id="n31642" type="hapax" key="objecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliorum objectationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objectio: <entryFree id="n31643" type="main" key="objecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obicio</etym>, <sense id="n31643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putting before</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31643.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 100, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum objectione tutari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31643.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an upbraiding, reproach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">objectio nominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objectionem repellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus facti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 445</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31643.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An objection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fide, 4, 9, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 166:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 166, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 16, 20</bibl>; Aug. Nat. et <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> 10</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:324" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 324</bibl> and 346.—</sense><sense id="n31643.4" n="C" level="2"> As rhet. fig., = anthypophora, Jul. Rufin. Schem. Dian. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
objecto: <entryFree id="n31644" type="main" key="objecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against, to set against, oppose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31644.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(pelagi volucres) Nunc caput objectare fretis, nunc currere in undas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dive down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc illuc clipeum objectans,</quote> <trans><tr>opposing, presenting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:662" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingerit objectans trepidantibus ora leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 194</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31644.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31644.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n31644.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To abandon, expose, endanger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit eum objectare periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput periclis,</quote> <trans><tr>to expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dolo simul et casibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31644.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw in the way, interpose, cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31644.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31644.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw out, charge, object, to reproach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upbraid with, to accuse of</hi> any thing as a crime (so most freq., but whether used by Cic. is doubtful): <cit><quote lang="la">objectare alicui inopiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus mihi tu objectas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probrum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl>: cum in colloquiis Pompeiani famem nostris objectarent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneficia in principem et devotiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="OBJU" /> 52: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatas et inopes legiones Trebellio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum (i. e. filii mortem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 400</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi objectent lenocinium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas objectare Fabio fugisse eum Appium Claudium collegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15, 12</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n31644.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To throw out, let fall, say</hi> any thing (disagreeable) to any one: <cit><quote lang="la">cave tu illi objectes nunc in aegritudine, Te has emisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objector: <entryFree id="n31645" type="hapax" key="objector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obicio</etym>, <sense id="n31645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accuser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi criminis objectores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 130, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objectus: <entryFree id="n31646" type="main" key="objectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31647" type="main" key="objectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obicio</etym>, <sense id="n31647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting before, a putting against, in the way</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">opposite, an opposing;</hi> or, <hi rend="ital">neutr., a lying before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): dare objectum parmaï, <hi rend="ital">the opposing of the shield</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 847</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula portum Efficit objectu laterum,</quote> <trans><tr>by the opposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terga flumine, latera objectu paludis tegerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones, quae Tauri montis objectu separantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem interventu lunae occultari, lunamque terrae objectu,</quote> <trans><tr>the interposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: eademque (terra) objectu suo umbram noctemque efficiat, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 243, 13</bibl> dub. (al. objecta soli): <cit><quote lang="la">hi molium objectus (i. e. moles objectas) scandere,</quote> <trans><tr>the projection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31647.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which presents itself to the sight, an object, appearance, sight, spectacle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 2</bibl> (al. objecto).</sense></entryFree>
objex: <entryFree id="n31648" type="main" key="objex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objex</orth>, v. obex.</entryFree>
objurgatio: <entryFree id="n31649" type="main" key="objurga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objurgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>objurgo</etym>, <sense id="n31649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chiding, reproving, reproof, rebuke, reprehension</hi> (class.): objurgatio post turpe factum castigatio; monitio vero est ante commissum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=196" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 196</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut objurgatio contumeliā careat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum objurgatio, si est auctoritas, tum admonitio quasi lenior objurgatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgationes etiam non numquam incidunt necessariae, in quibus utendum est fortasse et vocis contentione majore et verborum gravitate acriori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut castigatione aut objurgatione dignum putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgationes (opp. laudationes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objurgator: <entryFree id="n31650" type="main" key="objurga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objurgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chider, rebuker, blamer</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic noster objurgator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevoli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
objurgatorius: <entryFree id="n31651" type="main" key="objurga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objurgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>objurgator</etym>, <sense id="n31651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chiding, reproving, reproachful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:26:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
objurgito: <entryFree id="n31652" type="main" key="objurgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">objurgĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>objurgo</etym>, <sense id="n31652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chide, rebuke, reproach violently</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbis multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
objurgo: <entryFree id="n31653" type="main" key="objurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-jurgo</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">objūrĭgo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>), āvi, ātum, 1 (<sense id="n31653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi> objurgatus, as a <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> signif.: Hirrius Curionem non mediocriter objurgatus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to chide, scold, blame, rebuke, reprove</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: increpo, improbo, vitupero); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing;</hi> post-class. also with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n31653.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgat is, qui id facit (i. e. jurgat) juste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 93</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Menelaus me objurgat, Enn. ap. Rufin. Fig. (Trag. v. 264 Vahl.): quod Chrysalus med objurgavit plurimis verbis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgavit M. Caelium, sicut neminem umquam parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monendi amici saepe sunt et objurgandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, in quo te objurgem, id ipsum videar imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem molli bracchio de aliquā re,</quote> <trans><tr>moderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum objurgarer, quod nimiā laetitiā paene desiperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—With an abstract object: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar meam in rogando verecundiam objurgavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si objurgaret populi segnitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 107:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 107, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte objurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: sic objurgant, quasi <cb n="OBLE" /> oderint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum objurgamus, maledicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31653.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: objurgo filium veteres dicebant; nos, objurgo filio, ut Graeci (sc. <foreign lang="greek">e)pitima=n tini</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 305</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgavi eos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 13, 25.—With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgare haec me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31653.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n31653.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dissuade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deter</hi> one from any thing, by means of reproof: <cit><quote lang="la">objurgans me a peccatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31653.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To urge in a tone of reproof, to exhort earnestly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (epistulā) me objurgas, ut firmior sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31653.6" n="B" level="2"> Objurgare aliquem aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to punish, chastise, correct</hi> a person with any thing, = ferire, plectere (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">colaphis objurgare puerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soleā rubrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:169" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 169</bibl></cit>: sestertio centies objurgatus, <hi rend="ital">punished</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:36:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 36, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
objuro: <entryFree id="n31654" type="main" key="obju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-jūro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bind by an oath</hi>: objurare jurejurando obstringere, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 188 and 189 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
oblanguesco: <entryFree id="n31655" type="hapax" key="oblanguesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-languesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become feeble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">languid, to languish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterulae meae oblanguerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblaqueatio: <entryFree id="n31656" type="gloss" key="obla^que^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblăquĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oblaqueo, I.</etym>, <sense id="n31656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clearing away</hi> around trees: ARBORVM, Kalend. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 381</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblaqueo: <entryFree id="n31657" type="main" key="obla^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lăquĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31657.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig about the roots</hi> of trees, etc. (cf. ablaqueo): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores oblaqueatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31657.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To surround, encircle, set</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">argento gemmas oblaqueare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblaticius: <entryFree id="n31658" type="main" key="obla_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>offero</etym>, <sense id="n31658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freely offered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presented</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">impendium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: aurum, <hi rend="ital">a gratuitous offering of the Senate to the emperor</hi>, i. q. oblatio, Cod. Th. 6, 2, 5.</sense></entryFree>
oblatio: <entryFree id="n31659" type="main" key="obla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offering, presenting, a giving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bestowing gratuitously</hi> (post-class.; cf.: donum, munus, votum). </sense><sense id="n31659.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum oblationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Const. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte oblatio ei fiat ejus, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:8:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 8, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31659.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a bid</hi> at an auction: qui ceteros oblatione superavit, Cod. Th. 5, 13, 18.—</sense><sense id="n31659.3" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a gift, present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimi ordinis, Cod. Th. 6, 2, 14: si maritus ad oblationem dei uxori donavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31659.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an offering, sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cain, 2, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblativus: <entryFree id="n31660" type="main" key="obla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freely given, voluntarily presented</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">auguria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">functiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:43" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblator: <entryFree id="n31661" type="main" key="obla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an offerer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animae suae pro populi salute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cain, 2, 6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblatratio: <entryFree id="n31662" type="main" key="obla_tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oblatro</etym>, <sense id="n31662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barking at;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a railing, scolding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 133, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblatrator: <entryFree id="n31663" type="main" key="obla_tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that barks at; a barker, railer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblatratrix: <entryFree id="n31664" type="hapax" key="obla_tra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>oblatrator</etym>, <sense id="n31664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female barker, railer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblatratricem in aedes intromittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblatro: <entryFree id="n31665" type="main" key="obla_tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lātro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n31665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to bark at;</hi> only in the trop. signif., <hi rend="ital">to rail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carp at</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n31665.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblatrare veritati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31665.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:251" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. S. 3, 13, 92</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 913.—</sense><sense id="n31665.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblatus: <entryFree id="n31666" type="main" key="obla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from offero.</entryFree>
oblectabilis: <entryFree id="n31667" type="main" key="oblecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oblecto</etym>, <sense id="n31667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delightful, pleasant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblectamen: <entryFree id="n31668" type="main" key="oblecta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delight</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for oblectamentum, and perh. only in <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulat ut sacras, hominum oblectamina, sortes,</quote> <trans><tr>sources of consolation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 412</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblectamentum: <entryFree id="n31669" type="main" key="oblecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delight, pleasure, amusement</hi> (class.; cf.: voluptas, deliciae); with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies oblectamentumque senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblectamenta puerorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblectamenta et solatia servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: rerum rusticarum, <pb n="1236" /> <cb n="OBLI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 55</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei in oblectamentis draco serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblectaneus: <entryFree id="n31670" type="gloss" key="oblecta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblectānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>oblecto</etym>, <sense id="n31670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delightful, pleasant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 304, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblectatio: <entryFree id="n31671" type="main" key="oblecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delighting, delight</hi> (a favorite word of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">indagatio ipsa habet oblectationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requies plena oblectationis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblectator: <entryFree id="n31672" type="main" key="oblecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delighter, pleaser, charmer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">beluarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 358, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
oblectatorius: <entryFree id="n31673" type="main" key="oblecta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lectātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delighting, pleasing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aenigmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
oblecto: <entryFree id="n31674" type="main" key="oblecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. lacto</etym>, <sense id="n31674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to delight, please, divert, entertain, amuse</hi> (class.; most freq. with se and mid.; syn. delecto); constr. usually <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> (aliquid, se), with <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n31674.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam diutissime te jucundā opinione oblectarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eorum inventis scriptisque se oblectent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se agri cultione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falso gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musae me oblectant carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 8</bibl></cit>.—With an impers. object: <cit><quote lang="la">legentium animos fictis oblectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ironically: paulum praesidii, qui familiarem suam vitam oblectet modo,</quote> <trans><tr>cheer, comfort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam sordido pane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">in communibus miseriis hac tamen oblectabar speculā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis oblectamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31674.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblecta te cum Cicerone quam bellissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his me oblecto, qui res gestas scripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">elliptically: ego me interea cum libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31674.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo me oblecto,</quote> <trans><tr>I delight in him, he is my delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in hortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me in Cumano et Pompeiano satis commode oblectabam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>amused myself excellently well in Cumanum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31674.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime equidem me oblectavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortulos emere ubi se oblectare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te oblectes scire cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 321</bibl></cit>.—With an impers. object: <cit><quote lang="la">haec studia adulescentiam alunt, senectutem oblectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31674.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> time <hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio lacrimabile tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iners otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter cenam oblectamus otium temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31674.6" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">to delay, detain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum interea hic oblectabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mi ubi, Philotis, te oblectāsti tam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblenio: <entryFree id="n31675" type="main" key="oble_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lēnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n31675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to soften, soothe</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lectio carminum illum obleniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblicus: <entryFree id="n31676" type="main" key="oblicus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblicus</orth>, v. obliquus.</entryFree>
oblido: <entryFree id="n31677" type="main" key="obli_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-līdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laedo</etym>. <sense id="n31677.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To squeeze together</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum digitulis duobus oblidere, Cic. Scaur. § 10, p. 261 Orell.: oblisis faucibus,</quote> <trans><tr>strangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">obliso gutture,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 589</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31677.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To squeeze</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crush to pieces</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblisus pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obligamentum: <entryFree id="n31678" type="main" key="obli^ga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>obligo</etym>. <sense id="n31678.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput obligamento obnoxium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31678.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an obligation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis obligamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ephes. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obligatio: <entryFree id="n31679" type="main" key="obli^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n31679.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n31679.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A binding</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">propter linguae obligationem,</quote> <trans><tr>because of his being tongue-tied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31679.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ensnaring, entangling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinantes in obligationes,</quote> <trans><tr>evil devices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:124:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 124, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obligatione iniquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31679.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n31679.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An engaging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pledging, an obligation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est gravior et difficilior animi et sententiae pro aliquo quam pecuniae obligatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligationis onere praetoris auxilio non levabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligationes ex contractu aut re contrahuntur, aut verbis, aut consensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 7, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31679.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <cb n="OBLI" /> <hi rend="ital">an obligatory relation</hi> between two persons, one of whom has a right and the other a duty (the <hi rend="ital">right</hi> of the creditor and the <hi rend="ital">duty</hi> of the debtor): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc transeamus ad obligationes: omnis enim obligatio vel ex contractu nascitur vel ex delicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:88" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sqq.: obligationum substantia in eo consistit, ut alium nobis obstringat ad dandum aliquid, vel faciendum, vel praestandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:108" default="NO">45, 1, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex maleficio nascuntur obligationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligatio et constituitur et solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:140" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n31679.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The document which confirms this relation, a bond, obligation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignoris obligatio etiam inter absentes recte ex contractu obligatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:11:28" default="NO">48, 11, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obligatorius: <entryFree id="n31680" type="main" key="obli^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obligo</etym>, <sense id="n31680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">binding, obligatory</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:2:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:27:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 27, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
obligatura: <entryFree id="n31681" type="gloss" key="obli^ga_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band, bandage</hi>: obligatura, <foreign lang="greek">kata/desmos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
obligatus: <entryFree id="n31682" type="main" key="obli^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from obligo.</entryFree>
obligo: <entryFree id="n31683" type="main" key="obli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n31683.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31683.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie around, to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten to</hi> any thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">obligatus corio,</quote> <trans><tr>bound in a leathern sack</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulis muscus obligatus,</quote> <trans><tr>bound upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 66, § 105</bibl></cit>: cibum ovis, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unite with eggs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amylo spisso obligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:2" default="NO">8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind together, bind up</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pecua ad hanc collo in crumena ego obligata defero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: age obliga, obsigna cito, <hi rend="ital">tie up</hi> (the letter, in order to seal it), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:40" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind up, bandage, swathe</hi> (class., esp. of wounds): <cit><quote lang="la">crus fractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medicum requirens, a quo obligetur,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind up his wounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <trans><tr>to bandage the veins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculum libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore obligato obsignatoque simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31683.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bind, oblige, put under an obligation, make liable</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obstringo, devincio): aliquem obligare militiae secundo sacramento,</quote> <trans><tr>bind by a second oath, swear in again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadem tribus milibus aeris,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind in the sum of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti sponsio, quā obligamur deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se nexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: se in acta cujusquam, Tib. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se chirographo ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:103" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sibi liberalitate,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind to one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligabis me,</quote> <trans><tr>will oblige me, lay me under an obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligari foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33</bibl></cit>: pro amicis alicui obligari, <hi rend="ital">to lay one's self under obligation</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to solicit favors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligor ipse tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligatus ei nihil eram,</quote> <trans><tr>was under no obligation to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me obligatum tibi fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligati sunt interrogatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prometheus obligatus aliti,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted, condemned to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:67" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo obligatam redde Jovi dapem,</quote> <trans><tr>vowed, due</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligor, ut tangam laevi fera litora Ponti,</quote> <trans><tr>am compelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31683.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To render liable through guilt, to make guilly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populum Romanum scelere obligāsses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votis caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>: se furti, Scaev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 15, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass., to be guilty of, to commit</hi> an offence: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim periculum, ne aut neglectis iis impiā fraude, aut susceptis anili superstitione obligemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lege Corneliā testamentariā obligatur,</quote> <trans><tr>offends against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:10:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.8" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n31683.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bind, engage</hi> one (cf. obligatio, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">obligandi, solvendi sui causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:6:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 6, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se obligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:7:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 2, 7, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:25:section=9" default="NO">21, 1, 25, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pledge, pawn, mortgage</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratui bona ejus obligantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praedia fratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia bona sua pignori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam fundi et aedis obligatae sunt ob amoris praedium,</quote> <trans><tr>has a mortgage on it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes pignori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligata praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31683.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the jurid. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">obligare fidem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to pledge one's word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31683.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To impede, restrain, embarrass</hi>:<cb n="OBLI" />  judicio districtum atque obligatum esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 24</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭ-gātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., bound, obliged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem (officiis) me tibi obligatum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto quis melior et probior, tanto mihi obligatior abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi obligati sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>ensnared, embarrassed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 19, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obligurio: <entryFree id="n31684" type="main" key="obli^gu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lĭgūrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-lĭgurrĭo</orth>), <itype>4</itype>, <sense id="n31684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to devour, consume, squander</hi> (very rare): mox dum alterius obligurias omnia, Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Vahl. Sat. Rel. v. 29, reads abligurias): obligurisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:26" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 26</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
obliguritor: <entryFree id="n31685" type="main" key="obli^gu_ri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭgūrītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rr-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>obligurio</etym>, <sense id="n31685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who consumes his property in feasting, a squanderer, dissipated person</hi> (postclass.), Firm. Math. 5, 5, 2.</sense></entryFree>
oblimo: <entryFree id="n31686" type="main" key="obli_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblīmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ob-limus</etym>, <sense id="n31686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slime</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31686.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): Aegyptum Nilus irrigat, mollitosque et oblimatos ad serendum agros relinquit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae oblimatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos (i. e. partes genitales),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 136</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n31686.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, qs. to scatter one's fortune as if it were slime, <hi rend="ital">to lavish, squander, dissipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem patris oblimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit> Heind.—</sense><sense id="n31686.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to darken, obscure, confuse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">humanas oblimat copia mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblinio: <entryFree id="n31687" type="main" key="obli^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lĭnĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, itum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (post-Aug. collat. form of oblino, q. v.), <sense id="n31687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bedaub, besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talearum capita misto fimo cum cinere oblinire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:2" default="NO">12, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:6" default="NO">12, 44, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aliquem caeno, luto oblinierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">oblinierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 230" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis oblinita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 245</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31687.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blot out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanct. 3, 10, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
oblinitus: <entryFree id="n31688" type="main" key="obli^ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblĭnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. oblino <sense id="n31688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
oblino: <entryFree id="n31689" type="main" key="obli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ob-lĭno</orth>, <itype>lēvi, rarely lĭni</itype> (Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.), lĭtum, 3 (form acc. to the 4th conj. oblinio, q. v.), <sense id="n31689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to daub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smear over, to bedaub, besmear</hi> (syn.: inficio, induco). </sense><sense id="n31689.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31689.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cerussā malas oblinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se visco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliti unguentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblitus caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblitus faciem suo cruore,</quote> <trans><tr>having besmeared his face with his own blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 367</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31689.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To smear over, blot out, rub out</hi> any thing written (post-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deleo, interpolo, oblittero): vestrum obleverunt et vestri superscripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem oblinire,</quote> <trans><tr>to blot out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Spic. Savet. 3, 10, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bemire, befoul, defile</hi> (syn.: polluo, inquino, maculo): quid tu istuc curas, ubi ego oblinar atque voluter? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 420, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem caeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also II. A.—</sense><sense id="n31689.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stop up by smearing, to plaster over</hi> (syn. obturo): <cit><quote lang="la">dolia oblinito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblinitur minimae si qua est suspicio rimae,</quote> <trans><tr>is stopped up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:45:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gypso oblitus cadus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover over, fill</hi> with any thing (of things; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): villa oblita tabulis pictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31689.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To befoui, defile</hi> (class.): se externis moribus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblitus parricidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt omnia dedecore oblita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geram morem vobis et me oblinam sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem versibus atris,</quote> <trans><tr>to defame</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover over, to fill</hi> with any thing; <hi rend="ital">to fill to excess, to overload</hi>: facetiae oblitae Latio. <hi rend="ital">Roman wit which had received a Latin tincture</hi> (through the right of citizenship granted to the Latins), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiis oblitus actor,</quote> <trans><tr>covered, decked</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblita oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>overloaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustii scripta nimiā priscorum verborum affectatione oblita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31689.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover over, blind, deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicine mihi esse os oblitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
obliquatio: <entryFree id="n31690" type="main" key="obli_qua_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblīquātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obliquo</etym>, <sense id="n31690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending, winding, oblique direction</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
oblique: <entryFree id="n31691" type="main" key="obli_que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblīquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. obliquus <sense id="n31691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
obliquitas: <entryFree id="n31692" type="main" key="obli_qui^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblīquĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>obliquus</etym>, <sense id="n31692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sidelong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slanting direction, obliqueness, obliquity</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 40</bibl>: sigui <pb n="1237" /> <cb n="OBLI" /> feri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 17, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31692.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ambiguity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1137</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
obliquo: <entryFree id="n31693" type="main" key="obli_quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">oblīquo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obliquus</etym>, <sense id="n31693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn, bend</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">twist aside, awry</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in an oblique direction</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31693.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:323" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:749" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 12, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latus ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus (velorum) in ventum,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn obliquely to the wind, veer to the wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31693.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: obliquat preces, <hi rend="ital">makes, utters indirectly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dissemblingly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:381" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 143</bibl></cit>: Q (littera), cujus similis (litterae K) effectu specieque nisi quod paulum a nostris obliquatur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is pronounced somewhat softer</hi>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
